oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Fundraising letter to Merl R. Eppse
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Fundraising letter from Myles Horton to Merl Eppse touting Highlander's contributions on labor organizing and education.

Merl Raymond Eppse was a historian who taught at Tennessee State University for over 30 years. He served as president of the Tennessee Negro Education in the late 1940s and founded the National Publication Company in Nashville to publish his many books which included one of the first American History textbooks to include African American history. He retired in 1962 and moved to Los Angeles where he died in 1967. His donated his papers to the Tennessee State Library and Archives where they currently reside.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Eppse, Merl R. (Merl Raymond), 1893-; Labor unions and education; Labor movement; Leadership--Study and teaching; Labor leaders; Fund raising; Fieldwork (Educational method); Dairying, Cooperative
